The Elder Saccasaññaka
“At that time Vessabhū,
with the Community of monks in front,
was teaching the noble truths,
causing the great people to be extinguished.
I was filled with the highest compassion,
and I went to the assembly.
While sitting there,
I listened to the Teacher’s Teaching.

analyzed: tassa aham dhammam sutvāna  deva lokam agacchaha
translated: After hearing that Teaching,🔽I went to the deva world.
For thirty eons
I lived there in the past.
In the thirty-first eon,
I obtained that perception.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the perception of truth.
In the twenty-sixth eon,
there was a lord of the people
named Ekaphusita,
a powerful Wheel-turning Monarch.
The four analytical insights …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā saccasaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā saccasaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Saccasaññaka recited these verses.
